title: March Madness: A guide to the US college basketball tournament
description: Annual tournament happens each March, drawing millions of viewers who fill out brackets to predict next NCAA champions.

title: New York bike path killer avoids death penalty as jury deadlocks
description: Sayfullo Saipov has received life in prison for a 2017 attack that left eight people dead and others severely injured.

title: Kyiv criticises Russian proposal to extend grain deal for 60 days
description: Ukrainian minister says 60-day extension contradicts the documents signed by guarantors Turkey and the UN.

title: Ukrainian and Russian losses mount in fierce battle for Bakhmut
description: On the judicial front, ICC reportedly planning to seek arrest of Russian officials for deporting children from Ukraine.

title: US hate crimes increased nearly 12 percent in 2021, FBI says
description: Nearly 65 percent of the hate crimes were based on race and ethnicity, a report by the US security service says.

title: What are the implications of the Gary Lineker-BBC dispute?
description: How are broadcasters handling staff sharing opinions online?

title: Colombia’s Petro accuses armed group of violating ceasefire
description: Bogota accuses Gulf Clan of backing protests by illegal miners that cut off drinking water to communities in northwest.

title: Biden to announce nuclear submarine deal at Australia, UK talks
description: California meeting comes 18 months after creation of US-UK-Australia security pact to counter China in Pacific region.

title: The battle for the future of objectivity
description: Criticism of The New York Times's coverage of trans rights reveals the problem with claiming objectivity in journalism.

title: US approves contentious oil drilling project in Alaska
description: Biden administration's approval of Willow project in northwestern US state draws condemnation from environmental groups.

title: Pfizer strikes $43bn deal for cancer drug innovator Seagen
description: The pharmaceutical giant says it will pay $229 in cash for each share of Seagen.

title: Iran and Belarus sign cooperation roadmap in Lukashenko visit
description: The two presidents signed eight agreements on trade, mining and transportation.

title: Biden offers assurances after major US banks collapse

title: Saddam Hussein ‘disposed of’ near ex-PM’s home post-execution
description: Al-Kadhimi says Saddam had been left between his home and that of ex-PM Nouri al-Maliki before later being taken away.

title: Iraqis haunted by disappearances after Saddam Hussein’s fall
description: Iraq has one of the highest numbers of missing persons in the world, according to the Red Cross.

description: Performer is the first Asian to win the Academy Award for best actress in a leading role.

title: Palestinians declared dead turn out to be alive
description: In two incidents in past six months, Palestinians have been declared dead by Israel, only to be discovered in hospital.

title: As Russia’s war drags, Ukraine’s nail bars provide joy and work
description: A Ukrainian couple operates a chain of nail salons, providing employment for IDPs and a sense of normality for clients.

title: Storm Freddy kills 15 in Malawi, Mozambique
description: Freddy, one of the strongest storms ever recorded in the southern hemisphere, ravages Southern Africa.

description: Secretary-General Antonio Guterres says latest report by UN climate scientists 'could not come at a more pivotal time'.

title: UN investigators slam sluggish help for Syria quake victims
description: Panel says the UN, the Syrian government and others are responsible for delays in getting emergency aid to Syrians.

title: Canada’s spies and the hypocrites who adore them

title: Gabon ferry death toll rises to six; 31 still missing
description: Search mission continues four days after Esther Miracle vessel carrying 161 people from Libreville to Port-Gentil sank.

title: Fire at Rohingya camps ‘planned sabotage’, Bangladesh panel says
description: Officials say the March 5 blaze broke out in several places at the same time, proving it was a planned act.

title: Why India’s revival of civil militias in Kashmir is raising fears
description: New Delhi revives the Village Defence Guards in southern Jammu area after seven Hindus are killed by suspected rebels.

title: Lineker to return to BBC’s Match of the Day after Twitter row
description: The hugely popular sports presenter had sparked a crisis at the public broadcaster after tweeting about UK asylum plans.

title: Travel under the influencers
description: Instead of being a mind-opening experience, travel in the influencer age has become an exercise in self-conceit.

title: US to approve Alaska ‘carbon bomb’ drilling project: Reports

title: HRW: Egyptian dissidents denied identity documents

description: China aims to follow up on its diplomatic success last week in negotiating an agreement between Iran and Saudi Arabia.

title: Japan court backs retrial for 87-year-old death row inmate

description: US regulators move to protect depositors amid concerns of broader fallout from second-largest bank failure in history.

title: N Korea conducts new weapons tests; US, S Korea start drills
description: North Korea says allies' military exercises are a rehearsal for war so its weapons are vital for defence.
